info.description: This is the public Twilio REST API.
info.title: Twilio REST API

get.description: Retrieve a list of Commands from your account.

parameters.description: The `sid` or `unique_name` of the [Sim resources](https://www.twilio.com/docs/wireless/api/sim) to read.
parameters.name: Sim

parameters.description: The status of the resources to read. Can be: `queued`, `sent`, `delivered`, `received`, or `failed`.
parameters.name: Status

parameters.description: Only return Commands with this direction value.
parameters.name: Direction

parameters.description: Only return Commands with this transport value. Can be: `sms` or `ip`.
parameters.name: Transport

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

post.description: Send a Command to a Sim.

parameters.description: The message body of the Command. Can be plain text in text mode or a Base64 encoded byte string in binary mode.
parameters.name: Command

parameters.description: The `sid` or `unique_name` of the [SIM](https://www.twilio.com/docs/wireless/api/sim) to send the Command to.
parameters.name: Sim

parameters.description: The HTTP method we use to call `callback_url`. Can be: `POST` or `GET`, and the default is `POST`.
parameters.name: CallbackMethod

parameters.description: The URL we call using the `callback_url` when the Command has finished sending, whether the command was delivered or it failed.
parameters.name: CallbackUrl

parameters.description: The mode to use when sending the SMS message. Can be: `text` or `binary`. The default SMS mode is `text`.
parameters.name: CommandMode

parameters.description: Whether to include the SID of the command in the message body. Can be: `none`, `start`, or `end`, and the default behavior is `none`. When sending a Command to a SIM in text mode, we can automatically include the SID of the Command in the message body, which could be used to ensure that the device does not process the same Command more than once.  A value of `start` will prepend the message with the Command SID, and `end` will append it to the end, separating the Command SID from the message body with a space. The length of the Command SID is included in the 160 character limit so the SMS body must be 128 characters or less before the Command SID is included.
parameters.name: IncludeSid

parameters.description: Whether to request delivery receipt from the recipient. For Commands that request delivery receipt, the Command state transitions to 'delivered' once the server has received a delivery receipt from the device. The default value is `true`.
parameters.name: DeliveryReceiptRequested

delete.description: Delete a Command instance from your account.

parameters.description: The SID of the Command resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

get.description: Fetch a Command instance from your account.

parameters.description: The SID of the Command resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: An application-defined string that uniquely identifies the resource. It can be used in place of the resource's `sid` in the URL to address the resource.
parameters.name: UniqueName

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It does not have to be unique.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: Whether SIMs can use GPRS/3G/4G/LTE data connectivity.
parameters.name: DataEnabled

parameters.description: The total data usage (download and upload combined) in Megabytes that the Network allows during one month on the home network (T-Mobile USA). The metering period begins the day of activation and ends on the same day in the following month. Can be up to 2TB and the default value is `1000`.
parameters.name: DataLimit

parameters.description: The model used to meter data usage. Can be: `payg` and `quota-1`, `quota-10`, and `quota-50`. Learn more about the available [data metering models](https://www.twilio.com/docs/wireless/api/rate-plan#payg-vs-quota-data-plans).
parameters.name: DataMetering

parameters.description: Whether SIMs can make, send, and receive SMS using [Commands](https://www.twilio.com/docs/wireless/api/commands).
parameters.name: MessagingEnabled

parameters.description: Whether SIMs can make and receive voice calls.
parameters.name: VoiceEnabled

parameters.description: Whether SIMs can roam on networks other than the home network (T-Mobile USA) in the United States. See [national roaming](https://www.twilio.com/docs/wireless/api/rate-plan#national-roaming).
parameters.name: NationalRoamingEnabled

parameters.description: The list of services that SIMs capable of using GPRS/3G/4G/LTE data connectivity can use outside of the United States. Can be: `data`, `voice`, and `messaging`.
parameters.name: InternationalRoaming

parameters.description: The total data usage (download and upload combined) in Megabytes that the Network allows during one month on non-home networks in the United States. The metering period begins the day of activation and ends on the same day in the following month. Can be up to 2TB. See [national roaming](https://www.twilio.com/docs/wireless/api/rate-plan#national-roaming) for more info.
parameters.name: NationalRoamingDataLimit

parameters.description: The total data usage (download and upload combined) in Megabytes that the Network allows during one month when roaming outside the United States. Can be up to 2TB.
parameters.name: InternationalRoamingDataLimit

parameters.description: The SID of the RatePlan resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the RatePlan resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the RatePlan resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: An application-defined string that uniquely identifies the resource. It can be used in place of the resource's `sid` in the URL to address the resource.
parameters.name: UniqueName

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It does not have to be unique.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

get.description: Retrieve a list of Sims from your account.

parameters.description: Only return Sim resources with this status.
parameters.name: Status

parameters.description: Only return Sim resources with this ICCID. Currently this should be a list with maximum size 1.
parameters.name: Iccid

parameters.description: The `sid` or `unique_name` of the [RatePlan resource](https://www.twilio.com/docs/wireless/api/rate-plan) used by the Sim resources to read.
parameters.name: RatePlan

parameters.description: Deprecated.
parameters.name: EId

parameters.description: Only return Sim resources with this registration code.
parameters.name: SimRegistrationCode

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

delete.description: Delete a Sim resource from your account.

parameters.description: The SID of the Sim resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

get.description: Fetch a Sim resource from your account.

parameters.description: The SID of the Sim resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

post.description: Updates the given properties of a Sim resource from your account.

parameters.description: The SID of the Sim resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: An application-defined string that uniquely identifies the resource. It can be used in place of the `sid` in the URL path to address the resource.
parameters.name: UniqueName

parameters.description: The HTTP method we use to call `callback_url`. Can be: `POST` or `GET`, and the default is `POST`.
parameters.name: CallbackMethod

parameters.description: The URL we call using the `callback_url` when the SIM has finished updating. When the SIM transitions from `new` to `ready` or from any status to `deactivated`, we call this URL when the status changes to an intermediate status (`ready` or `deactivated`) and again when the status changes to its final status (`active` or `canceled`).
parameters.name: CallbackUrl

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It does not need to be unique.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: The `sid` or `unique_name` of the [RatePlan resource](https://www.twilio.com/docs/wireless/api/rate-plan) that this SIM should use.
parameters.name: RatePlan

parameters.description: The new status of the resource. Can be: `ready`, `active`, `suspended` or `deactivated`; however the SIM might support additional values.
parameters.name: Status

parameters.description: The HTTP method we use to call `commands_callback_url`.  Can be: `POST` or `GET`, and the default is `POST`.
parameters.name: CommandsCallbackMethod

parameters.description: The URL we call using the `commands_callback_method` when the SIM originates a [Command](https://www.twilio.com/docs/wireless/api/commands). Your server should respond with an HTTP status code in the 200 range; any response body is ignored.
parameters.name: CommandsCallbackUrl

parameters.description: The HTTP method we use to call `sms_fallback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.
parameters.name: SmsFallbackMethod

parameters.description: The URL we call using the `sms_fallback_method` when an error occurs while retrieving or executing the TwiML requested from `sms_url`.
parameters.name: SmsFallbackUrl

parameters.description: The HTTP method we use to call `sms_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.
parameters.name: SmsMethod

parameters.description: The URL we call using the `sms_method` when the SIM-connected device sends an SMS message that is not a [Command](https://www.twilio.com/docs/wireless/api/commands).
parameters.name: SmsUrl

parameters.description: The HTTP method we use to call `voice_fallback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.
parameters.name: VoiceFallbackMethod

parameters.description: The URL we call using the `voice_fallback_method` when an error occurs while retrieving or executing the TwiML requested from `voice_url`.
parameters.name: VoiceFallbackUrl

parameters.description: The HTTP method we use when we call `voice_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.
parameters.name: VoiceMethod

parameters.description: The URL we call using the `voice_method` when the SIM-connected device makes a voice call.
parameters.name: VoiceUrl

parameters.description: Initiate a connectivity reset on the SIM. Set to `resetting` to initiate a connectivity reset on the SIM. No other value is valid.
parameters.name: ResetStatus

parameters.description: The SID of the [Sim resource](https://www.twilio.com/docs/wireless/api/sim) with the Data Sessions to read.
parameters.name: SimSid

parameters.description: The date that the record ended, given as GMT in [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html) format.
parameters.name: End

parameters.description: The date that the Data Session started, given as GMT in [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html) format.
parameters.name: Start

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: The SID of the [Sim resource](https://www.twilio.com/docs/wireless/api/sim)  to read the usage from.
parameters.name: SimSid

parameters.description: Only include usage that occurred on or before this date, specified in [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html).
parameters.name: End

parameters.description: Only include usage that has occurred on or after this date, specified in [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html).
parameters.name: Start

parameters.description: How to summarize the usage by time. Can be: `daily`, `hourly`, or `all`. A value of `all` returns one Usage Record that describes the usage for the entire period.
parameters.name: Granularity

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

/v1/UsageRecords.description: Aggregated Usage information for all SIMs on an Account

parameters.description: Only include usage that has occurred on or before this date. Format is [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html).
parameters.name: End

parameters.description: Only include usage that has occurred on or after this date. Format is [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html).
parameters.name: Start

parameters.description: How to summarize the usage by time. Can be: `daily`, `hourly`, or `all`. A value of `all` returns one Usage Record that describes the usage for the entire period.
parameters.name: Granularity

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize
